content: wiosna is an airy and delicate one-skein shawl in the shape of an asymmetrical triangle it is worked seamlessly on bias sideways from the tip to the bind-off edge the shawl is made with an alternating garter stitch and lace stitch and finished with picots which adds charm and lightness **yarn support for this project was kindly provided by martin s lab yarn 1 ** **sizes** s l length 190 cm 220 cm / 76 88 depth 36 cm 40 cm / 14 5 16 **yarn** to make the shawl you ll need a skein of any fingering weight yarn about 360 m / 394 y for the size s and 460 / 504 y for the size l the light pink sample was knit with martin s lab merino singles 100% merino wool 366 m / 400 y per 100 g the brown-pink speckled sample was knit with martin s lab comfy merino 100% merino wool 400 m / 437 y per 100 g the blue sample was knit with martin s lab tibetan singles 65% merino wool 20% silk 15% yak 480 m / 525 y per 120 g note remember please that the yardage is estimated but the size of the shawl is easy adjustable **needles & notions** 4 0 mm 3 75 mm / us #6 us #5 circular needles 80 cm / 32 long row counter stitch markers optionally tapestry needle for weaving ends **gauge** 19 sts and 42 row = 10 x 10 cm / 4 x 4 -
